channel.title: NPR Programs: Morning Edition
channel.description: Morning Edition takes listeners around the country and the world with multi-faceted stories and commentaries every weekday. Hosts Steve Inskeep, Leila Fadel, Michel Martin and A Martínez bring you the latest breaking news and features to prepare you for the day.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: U.S.-Russia hold hourslong peace talks to discuss deal to end Ukraine war
item.description: The U.S. and Russia met for hours Tuesday to discuss the peace deal to end the war in Ukraine. Both sides called the talks "constructive," but no concrete steps were agreed upon.
item.content:encoded: The U.S. and Russia met for hours Tuesday to discuss the peace deal to end the war in Ukraine. Both sides called the talks "constructive," but no concrete steps were agreed upon.
item.dc:creator: Eleanor Beardsley

item.title: NATO foreign ministers to meet in Brussels without the U.S. in attendance
item.description: NATO foreign ministers will meet in Brussels Wednesday, and the ongoing negotiations to end the war in Ukraine will be top of mind. But there will be a notable absence: The U.S.
item.content:encoded: NATO foreign ministers will meet in Brussels Wednesday, and the ongoing negotiations to end the war in Ukraine will be top of mind. But there will be a notable absence: The U.S.
item.dc:creator: Teri Schultz

item.title: Former U.S. ambassador to NATO discusses Europe's views on Ukraine peace talks
item.description: NPR's Steve Inskeep speaks with Julianne Smith, former U.S. ambassador to NATO, about the latest Ukraine peace talks and Europe's role.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Steve Inskeep speaks with Julianne Smith, former U.S. ambassador to NATO, about the latest Ukraine peace talks and Europe's role.
item.dc:creator: Steve Inskeep

item.title: Morning news brief
item.description: U.S.-Russia call peace talks 'constructive,' but no concrete steps were agreed upon, Lawmakers still seek answers in deadly U.S. boat strike, Republicans hold on to House seat in Tennessee.
item.content:encoded: U.S.-Russia call peace talks 'constructive,' but no concrete steps were agreed upon, Lawmakers still seek answers in deadly U.S. boat strike, Republicans hold on to House seat in Tennessee.
item.dc:creator: Steve Inskeep

item.title: In 'Wings,' Paul McCartney recounts the making of his post-Beatles band
item.description: NPR's A Martinez speaks with Paul McCartney about his new book, "Wings: The Story of a Band on the Run," an oral history of the band McCartney formed after The Beatles broke up.
item.content:encoded: NPR's A Martinez speaks with Paul McCartney about his new book, "Wings: The Story of a Band on the Run," an oral history of the band McCartney formed after The Beatles broke up.
item.dc:creator: A Martínez

item.title: Costco sues the Trump administration over tariffs
item.description: Costco has filed a lawsuit challenging the Trump administration's tariffs. The retailer joins other companies hoping to get a refund for the import taxes it's already paid.
item.content:encoded: Costco has filed a lawsuit challenging the Trump administration's tariffs. The retailer joins other companies hoping to get a refund for the import taxes it's already paid.
item.dc:creator: Scott Horsley

item.title: 'They are not alone': Migrants rely on faith communities amid immigration crackdown
item.description: In the face of the Trump administration's ongoing immigration crackdown, many immigrants are living in a relentless state of fear and anxiety. In California, some lean on their faith communities.
item.content:encoded: In the face of the Trump administration's ongoing immigration crackdown, many immigrants are living in a relentless state of fear and anxiety. In California, some lean on their faith communities.
item.dc:creator: Tyche Hendricks

item.title: Florida river becomes substitute site for sacred Hindu funeral tradition
item.description: The Ganges River in India is a final resting place for the ashes of loved ones. For those who can't make the journey, a river in Florida has become a substitute for the funeral tradition.
item.content:encoded: The Ganges River in India is a final resting place for the ashes of loved ones. For those who can't make the journey, a river in Florida has become a substitute for the funeral tradition.
item.dc:creator: Rose Schnabel

item.title: The secret inside Russian nesting dolls? Most are made in China
item.description: The story of wooden nesting dolls is not just quintessentially Russian -- it's also Chinese.
item.content:encoded: The story of wooden nesting dolls is not just quintessentially Russian -- it's also Chinese.
item.dc:creator: John Ruwitch

item.title: This group of retirees spend their golden years protecting the environment
item.description: Some people spend their retirement traveling or playing golf, but the volunteers with Philadelphia's Senior Environment Corps see themselves as watchdogs for the local environment.
item.content:encoded: Some people spend their retirement traveling or playing golf, but the volunteers with Philadelphia's Senior Environment Corps see themselves as watchdogs for the local environment.
